info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:13AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER... NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM EDT... At 713 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tarentum, or 9 miles north of Penn Hills, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Penn Hills, McCandless Township, Vandergrift, Apollo, Shaler Township, Plum, Murrysville, Hampton Township, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, and O`hara Township. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 38 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
